intro: Quercus volhynica, commonly known as the Volhynian oak, is a deciduous tree native to Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves and acorns. The tree typically grows to a height of 15–25 meters and has a straight trunk with a rounded crown. Its bark is grey and fissured, providing a rugged appearance. The Volhynian oak is adapted to temperate climates and plays an important role in forest ecosystems.
